snippet: Police notes from a case inherited by Detective Louis Scarcella say that two witnesses named killers different from the men who were convicted in a 1985 case.
abstract: Review of homicide convictions stemming from the work of Louis Scarcella, Brooklyn detective accused of framing suspects, turns up old handwritten police notes that could exonerate two men convicted of murder in 1985; Alvena Jennette was released on parole in 2007 after spending 21 years in prison, and Darryl Austin died behind bars; discovery is first major revelation disclosed by Brooklyn district attorney’s office since it began wide-ranging investigation into Scarcella.
lead_paragraph: Police notes from a case inherited by Detective Louis Scarcella say that two witnesses named killers different from the men who were convicted in a 1985 case.

headline.main: Notes Found in Review of Police Work Could Exonerate 2 Convicted in Killing
headline.print_headline: Notes Found in Review of Police Work Could Exonerate 2 Convicted in Killing
